Semantics¶

Semantic constraints.

Universal Sentence Encoder¶

class constraints.semantics.universal_sentence_encoder.UniversalSentenceEncoder(threshold=0.8, metric='cosine')[source]¶

Constraint using cosine similarity between Universal Sentence Encodings of x and x_adv where the text embeddings are created using InferSent.

Parameters

  • threshold (float, optional) – The threshold for the constraint to bet met. Defaults to 0.8

  • metric (str, optional) – The metric function to use. Must be one of TODO. Defaults to cosine.

Raises

ValueError – If metric is not supported

call_many(x, x_adv_list, original_text=None)[source]¶

Filters the list of perturbed texts so that the similarity between the original text and the perturbed text is greater than the threshold.

Parameters

  • x (str) – The original text

  • x_adv_list (list(str)) – A list of perturbed texts

  • original_text (type, optional) – Defaults to None.

Returns

A filtered list of perturbed texts where each perturbed text meets the similarity threshold.

get_infersent_model()[source]¶

Retrieves the InferSent model.

Returns

The pretrained InferSent model.

score(x, x_adv)[source]¶

Returns the metric similarity between embeddings of the text and the perturbed text.

Parameters

  • x (str) – The original text

  • x_adv (str) – The perturbed text

Returns

The similarity between the original and perturbed text using the metric.

@TODO should this support multiple sentences for x_adv?

score_list(x, x_adv_list)[source]¶

Returns the metric similarity between the embedding of the text and a list of perturbed text.

Parameters

  • x (str) – The original text

  • x_adv_list (list(str)) – A list of perturbed texts

Returns

A list with the similarity between the original text and each perturbed text in x_adv_list. If x_adv_list is empty, an empty tensor is returned
